docs.summary: Switches are used for a single binary choice.

srcDocs.summary: Switches are used for a single binary choice.

docs.summary: Sets or gets whether a switch is on or off.
description: Setting the `checked` property to `true` toggles the switch to the on
position. Setting it to `false` toggles the switch to the off position.
Getting the `checked` property returns whether the switch is on or off.

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets whether a switch is on or off.
description: Setting the `checked` property to `true` toggles the switch to the on
position. Setting it to `false` toggles the switch to the off position.
Getting the `checked` property returns whether the switch is on or off.

docs.summary: Sets or gets a switch's value.
description: The `value` property is not related to whether the switch is on or
off. To determine whether the switch is on or off, use the [`checked`](#checked)
property.
The `value` property is used for storing a value that is associated with
the switch.
It does not trigger an `onChange` event when the value is modified.
Even if a switch is connected to a dataset, its `value` property
is not related to the value of the collection field it is connected to.
The field's value is determined by the switch's [`checked`](#checked) property.

The `value` property is used for storing a value that is associated with
the switch.
It does not trigger an `onChange` event when the value is modified.
Even if a switch is connected to a dataset, its `value` property
is not related to the value of the collection field it is connected to.
The field's value is determined by the switch's [`checked`](#checked) property.
